channel.title: 2016 on Jun Woo Shin
channel.description: Recent content in 2016 on Jun Woo Shin

item.title: Frontend Please
item.description: Ever since I finally got around to uninstalling Lazarus, I had determined that I would make an extension to fulfill the void that it left.

item.title: The Singers of Central Park
item.description: Nikon D5300 35mm | F/1.8 | 1/160 sec | ISO 400 When you live in New York City, you get used to a lot of things - the handing out of mixtapes, street performances, and a lot more.

item.title: Another Shell
item.description: GitHub: ash Demo: N/A I’ve been using the commandline for a while, especially Bash but I never thought about how they had been developed or their inner workings.

item.title: Android
item.description: My first phone was a Motorola Razer, I’m sure you have fond memory of those. After that it was the sidekick LX and then a Blackberry.

item.title: Slack Zmachine
item.description: GitHub: slack zmachine Demo: N/A This is a simple slack bot to allow users to play zmachine text based games through Slack.

item.title: JavaScript Frotz
item.description: GitHub: JavaScript Frotz Demo: N/A Frotz is a zmachine interpreter for text based games, such as Zork.

item.title: Making Titles is Hard
item.description: Nikon D5300 35mm | F/4 | 1/500 sec | ISO 100 I’ve never been one for titles.

item.title: Themes
item.description: For as long as I can remember, theming was very important to me. Aesthetics. My idea was that if I were going to use something, it should look nice so that I would enjoy using it.

item.title: Asthma
item.description: It was a cold day and I could feel my feet beginning to get cold. A little itch began to creep up my throat, bringing out a small cough - much better.

item.title: I'm Kind of Lazy
item.description: I’ve never considered myself to be especially unhealthy or not fit. There was a period in time in which I rarely went outside around early elementary school days, but besides that I was actively going out to play.

item.title: A Rainy Fourth Of July
item.description: Nikon D5300 18mm | F/20 | 1/3 sec | ISO 100 My friends and I decided to bike to Booklyn Heights Promenade to watch the Macy’s Fourth of July fireworks show.

item.title: Pocketistic
item.description: I like to think that I am a decent reader - Pocket certainly seemed to think so.

item.title: Straight Down A SoHo Street
item.description: Nikon D5300 18mm | F/4 | 1/800 sec | ISO 100 This was taken when I was walking around SoHo with my friend and he suddenly said “this would be a nice shot” as we were crossing the street.

item.title: Reviving the Blog
item.description: It’s been a few months since my last post because I’ve just been so busy with school.

item.title: Clock
item.description: GitHub: clock Demo: https://jwoos.github.io/web_clock/ This is a simple clock that I made. I had planned on making it much fancier with smooth animations and better styling but this is just what I ended up with!

item.title: Another New Computer
item.description: After dealing with a very old and sluggish desktop for a long time, I finally had enough and decided to build my own computer.
